turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So, Mr. Johnson --

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Tor!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Tor.  Have you ever thought about becoming an actor?

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Mm, not good-lookink enough.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I think you're quite handsome.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: No.  With hair, yah.  But I must shave head for wrestlink.  It scare da crowds.  Dey like that.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, I think you'd be a sensation in pictures.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: But what bout accent?  Some people tink I haf too much accent.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Nah, that doesn't matter!  It's a visual medium.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So anyway, I've got this new script, "Bride Of The Atom," and there's a part you're ideal for: "Lobo."  He's tough.  A brute.  But he has a heart -- and at the end he saves the girl.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: I like.  When do movie shoot?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hopefully, very soon.  I'm just awaiting the final okay from Mr. Feldman at MGM.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Edvard!   I haf question 'bout script. My vife Greta, she read.  And she no like.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Really?  Was the third act too intense?

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: No.  She tink Lobo is waste of my time.  Lobo don't talk.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But Tor, it's a starring part! You're second billed.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Bela, he talk.  Loretta, she talk. But Tor, he no talk.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Tor, dialogue is overrated.  You look at the classic film actors, who are they?  Fairbanks.  Chaplin.  They didn't talk!  They did it all with their face.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: But Greta say --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Here's the scene.  Loretta, you're in a trance.  You glide in and get on the operating table.  Now Tor, you're supposed to tie her down.  But you have an angora fetish... and when you rub that swatch of angora, it makes you refuse so Bela has to discipline you.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Okey-dokey.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Hey!  You're not eatink.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Uh, I don't have much of an appetite lately.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: The food will make you feel bedder. Look at me -- I'm da happiest guy I know!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'd be happy too, if I had such a great family.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Don't worry.  You just haven't met right woman yet.  Oopsy.  That cabbage goes right through me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Tor, I should be getting home.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Nonsense!  You must try our hot glug.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: My friend, you tink Greta is first woman I ever see?  No!  Many duds, before I find her.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But I thought me and Dolores had something.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Forget her!  Move on.  A good lookink boy like you as you can have any girl you wish.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: My eyes are killink me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't worry.  We're almost there.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: What is happening?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: We're escaping!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Excuse me, Sir...?

turns.speaker: ORSON WELLES
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Uh, uh, I'm a young filmmaker, and a really big fan... and I just wanted to meet you.

turns.speaker: ORSON WELLES
turns.text: My pleasure.  I'm Orson Welles.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh.  Um, I'm Ed Wood!  So, what are you working on now?

turns.speaker: ORSON WELLES
turns.text: Eh, the financing just fell through for the third time on "Don Quixote." So I'm trying to finish a promo for something else.  But I can't find the soundtrack --  I think I left it in Malta.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I can't believe it.  These sound like <u>my</u> problems!

turns.speaker: ORSON WELLES
turns.text: It's the damn money men.  You never know who's a windbag, and who's got the goods.  And then they all think <u>they're</u> a director...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ain't that the truth!  I've even bad producers recut my movies --

turns.speaker: ORSON WELLES
turns.text: Ugh, I hate when that happens.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: And they always want to cast their buddies -- it doesn't even <u>matter</u> if they're right for the part!

turns.speaker: ORSON WELLES
turns.text: Tell me about it.  I'm supposed to do a thriller at Universal, and they want Charlton Heston to play a <u>Mexican</u>!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Mr. Welles, is it all worth it?

turns.speaker: ORSON WELLES
turns.text: It is when it works.  You know the one film of mine I can stand to watch?  "Kane."  The studio hated it... but they didn't get to touch a frame.  Ed, visions are worth fighting for. Why spend your life making someone else's dreams?

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Can I help you?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yes, I'm Ed Wood.  I'm here about directing the Christine Jorgensen picture.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Yeah, well a couple of things have changed.  It ain't gonna be the Christine Jorgensen story no more. Goddamn "Variety" printed the story before I had the rights, and now that bitch is asking for the sky.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So you're not gonna make the movie?

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: No, of COURSE I'm gonna make the movie!  I've already pre√≥sold Alabama and Oklahoma.  Those repressed Okies really go for that twisted pervert stuff.  So we'll just make it without that she-male.  We'll fictitionalize it.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Is there a script?

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Fuck no!  But there's a poster.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: It opens in nine weeks in Tulsa.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, Mr. Weiss, I'm your guy.  I work fast, and I'm a deal: I write AND direct.  And I'm good.  I just did a play in Hollywood, and Victor Crowley praised its realism.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Hmm.  There's five-hundred guys in town who can tell me the same thing. You said on the phone you had some kind of "special qualifications."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, Mr. Weiss, I've never told anyone what I'm about to tell you... but I really want this job.  I like to dress in women's clothing.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Are you a fruit?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, no, not at all!  I <u>love</u> women. Wearing their clothes makes me feel closer to them.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: So you're not a fruit?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Nah, I'm all man.  I even fought in WW2.  'Course, I <u>was</u> wearing ladies' undergarments under my uniform.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: You gotta be kiddin' me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Confidentially, I even paratrooped wearing a brassiere and panties. I'll tell ya, I wasn't scared of being killed, but I was <u>terrified</u> of getting wounded, and having the medics discover my secret.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: And this is why you think you're the most qualified to make my movie?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah.  I know what it's like to live with a secret, and worry about what people are gonna think of you... My girlfriend still doesn't know why her sweaters are always stretched out.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Mr. Weiss, I was thinkin' about what you said, about how all your movies have to make a profit.  And I realized, what's the one thing, that if you put in a movie, it'll be successful??

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Tits.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No.  Better than tits -- a <u>star</u>!

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Eddie, you must have me confused with David Selznick.  I don't make major motion pictures.  I make crap.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, but if you took that crap and put a star in it, you'd have something!

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Yeah.  Crap with a star.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No!  It would be something better! Something <u>impressive</u>.  The biggest moneymaker you've ever had!

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Fine, maybe you're right.  But it doesn't friggin' matter.  I can't afford a star, so I don't even know what we're talking about.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What if I told you you could have a star for $1000??

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Lugosi?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah!  <u>Lugosi</u>!

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Isn't he dead?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, he's not dead!  He lives in Baldwin Hills.  I met him recently, and he wants to be in our picture.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: OUR picture?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Uh, yeah.  Our picture.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Why would Lugosi want to be in a sex-change flick?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Because he's <u>my friend</u>.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: I thought this was gonna be a sex- change film!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: There's still a sex-change --

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Yeah!  Five pages right before it ends!  The rest of the show is about some schmuck who likes angora sweaters.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I don't think he's a schmuck.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: And what's with this new title?!  My poster says "I CHANGED MY SEX"!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So change the poster.  Trust me, you'll be better off.  This is a story that's gonna <u>grab</u> people.  It's about this guy.  He's crazy about this girl but he likes to wear dresses.  Should he tell her? Should he not tell her?  He's torn. George, this is DRAMA.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Ed!  What's with these revised pages?!  A scene in a smelting factory?  A buffalo stampede?? <u>Three-hundred soldiers storming Anzio</u> <u>Beach</u>??!  What's going on here?  I can't afford to film this nonsense!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't worry.  We're not gonna film any of it.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: <u>Then how's it gonna get in the</u> <u>picture</u>?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I know a guy in Universal's stock house -- he's giving me the footage for free.  This movie's gonna look like a million bucks.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: I think it's fifty-seven minutes long.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah?  Whatever.  So did you like it?

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Ed, what was the one thing I asked you to do?  Make it <u>seven reels long</u>. I've got contracts with my exhibitors.  If it ain't over an hour, they won't play it.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Gee, I used every frame of film we shot.  Maybe they won't notice.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: They'll notice.  Look, why don't you let me take over from here?  I can do a few tricks: Pad it out with more stock footage, add establishing shots...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Um, I guess --

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Good.  And one more thing.  I think your "Written, Directed, and Starring Ed Wood" credit is a bad idea.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Why?!  I did all those things!  Hell, I even built the props.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: And you did a bang-up job, too.  But you don't want other producers to know that's you in drag.  Trust me. It's a career killer.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But I'm proud.  I wrote, directed, and starred in it just like Orson Welles in "Citizen Kane"!

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Yeah??  Well Orson Welles didn't wear angora sweaters, did he??!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Georgie, what's with the stag footage??  You said you were cutting in <u>establishing shots</u>!

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: I did.  I established some tits and ass.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: "Where's the ads"?!  The ads are in Alabama, Indiana, and Missouri!  You schmuck, it ain't gonna play L.A.!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Why not??

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Because I can't sell it to save my life!  You made a goddamn feathered fish.  Is it an art film, a horror show, a hygiene flick?  Nobody knows! I'm beggin' people to book it.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Maybe it needs special handling.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: Screw you, Wood!  I even sunk more money into different titles: "Transvestite" "He Or She?" "I Led Two Lives"... It DOESN'T MATTER! Nobody wants to see the piece of shit.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You can't talk that way about my movie.

turns.speaker: GEORGIE
turns.text: "Your movie"?!  I wish it was your movie!  I wish I hadn't blown every dime I ever made into this stinkbomb. If I ever see you again, I'll kill you!!!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Hello.  You're sleeping in a tuxedo.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I got married last night.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Oh.  Congratulations.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The marriage already ended.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Oh.  My condolences.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What are you making?

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Booties for my father.  He gets cold in this hospital.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: How long's he been here?

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: This is my thirteenth pair.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Oh, it's you again.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, hi.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: You look beat.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I am.  How's your father?

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: He's better.  Thank you for asking.  How's your friend?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Not good...

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Oh, flowers!  I didn't know you were so traditional.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I just picked them up on the way over...

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: They're very nice.  Let me get my coat.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: So have you always lived in L.A.?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No.  I'm from back east.  You know, All-American small town... everybody knew everybody, I was a Boy Scout, my dad worked for the post office...

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Sounds like you lived in Grovers Corners.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Did you find it boring?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Nah, 'cause I had my comic books. And I read pulp magazines.  And I listened to the radio dramas...

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Oh.  I loved those shows!  "Inner Sanctum"... "The Shadow" --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah!  Don't forget "Mercury Theatre"... And then every Saturday, I'd go to the little movie theater down the street.  I even started ushering there.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: You're not gonna believe the first picture I ever saw.  Your friend's.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: "Dracula."

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: That <u>is</u> incredible!  You know, I had to sleep with the lights on for a week after seeing that movie.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I had to sleep with the lights on for a month.  But I never missed a Lugosi picture after that.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: A few years ago, I actually saw him do "Dracula" live.  I thought he was much scarier in person.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Kathy, I'm about to tell you something I've never told any girl on a first date.  But I think it's important that you know.  I like to wear women's clothes.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I like to wear women's clothes: Panties, brassieres, sweaters, pumps... it's just something I do. And I can't believe I'm telling you, but I really like you, and I don't want it getting in the way down the road.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Does this mean you don't like sex with girls?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No! I love sex with girls.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Oh.  Okay.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Stop!

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: STOP!

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Ed, this spaghetti sauce is delicious.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Thanks.  It's actually the only thing I know how to make.  Hey, can you grab that strainer?

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela died.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'd seen him in a coffin so many times, I expected him to jump out...

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Ed, you've got to snap out of this. Bela's dead -- <u>you're not</u>!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I might as well be.  I made shitty movies that nobody wanted to see.  I blew it.  All he wanted was a comeback... that last glory...

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Well you tried --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I was a fuckin' HACK!  I let people recut the movies, cast their relatives...  I let Bela down...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You know, when you rewrite a script, it just gets better and better!

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Do you want your buttons on the left or the right?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The left.  It's more natural.  Hey, I've got a scene where the aliens have the ultimate bomb.  What would that be made of?

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Uh, atomic energy?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No.  They're beyond that!  They're smarter than the humans.  What's <u>more</u> advanced?

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Dynamite --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, BIGGER!  What's the biggest energy??

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: The sun.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yes!  BINGO!  Solar energy!  Oh that's gonna seem so scientific.  This movie's gonna be the ultimate Ed Wood film.  <u>No compromises</u>.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Those assholes.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: The poor girl's out of a job.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah...  I should give her a call.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: You should feel lucky.  Ed's the only guy in town who doesn't pass judgment on people.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hell, if I did, I wouldn't have any friends.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Look, it's Dr. Tom.  Hey, Dr. Tom!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Who's Dr. Tom?

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: My chiropractor!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I can't get it to go up.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Ed, you're gonna miss your own premiere.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: C'mon!  Let's just go.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Ed, I'm so happy for you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Let's get married.

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: Huh?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: <u>Right now</u>.  Let's drive to Vegas!

turns.speaker: KATHY
turns.text: But it's pouring.  And the car top is stuck!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So?  It's only a five-hour drive. And it'll probably clear up, once we hit the desert.  Heck, it'll probably clear up once we drive around the corner.  I promise.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Excuse me, Miss Vampira?

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You don't know me, but my name is Ed Wood.  I'm a film producer.  I'm currently in production on a science-fiction piece, with Bela Lugosi and Swedish wrestler Tor Johnson.  And I saw you here, and I thought: Kismet!

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: I don't understand.  Do you want my autograph?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No.  I think my film is perfect for you.

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: You want me to show it on my TV program?  Well I got nothing to do with that.  You should call up the station manager at Channel Seven --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No!  I don't want you to show the movie, I want you to be <u>in it</u>!  See, maybe I should explain: We started shooting, but then after three days we got shut down.  So we're having a backers party, to raise some more money.  Perhaps you'd like to come next door and meet some of the backers...?

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: Uh, look, I'm with some friends, and we're about to eat --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Please!  It'll only take a minute. You can have some hors d'oeuvres, and meet my backers!  There's a really nice dentist from Oxnard...

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: Look buddy, I'm a big star.  I've got real offers from real studios.  I don't need to blow some dentist for a part.  So forget it!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, don't worry, I moved on.  I was just calling to see if you want to attend the world premiere of my new film, "Bride Of The Monster."

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: Didn't you just make one called "Bride Of The Atom"?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's the same film.  But the distributor wanted a punchier title. C'mon!  It's gonna be a big event -- we're going all out!  Bela, Tor, and Cris are coming.  You'll have fun!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm really sorry...

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: It's terrible.  People won't even return my calls.  It's like I don't exist.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I know what <u>that's</u> like.  Anyway, I brought a copy of the script.  You would play the "Ghoul's Wife."

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: The <u>Ghoul's Wife</u>?!  God, I can't believe I'm doing this...

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: Look... would it be possible to make the "Ghoul's Wife" a little less prominent, so people won't really notice me in the movie?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You don't wanna be noticed?

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: Exactly.  Hey, how 'bout this -- what if I don't have any lines?  I'll do the part mute!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: <u>It's uncanny</u>.

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: What's uncanny?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: LOOK AT HIS SKULL!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hell, I've seen a lot worse reviews. I've seen ones where they didn't even like the costumes!  Like, that last "Francis the Mule" picture -- it got <u>terrible</u> notices.  But it was a huge hit.

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: Lines around the block.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So don't take it too seriously. We're all doin' great work.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The set doesn't look right!  It looks too... empty.  Clutter it up.  Put a skeleton in the corner.  And what's that thing over there?

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well it looks good.  Let's use it!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Just like I always promised.  Now you're among the immortals.  You're movie stars.

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: Here's to Ed.  For making us into something.

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: Uh, yoo-hoo.  Excuse me!  Sorry to interrupt, but I got some big news.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah...?

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: Well my cousin Fred met this dame from back East.  She's from "old money," and he thinks she's loaded. And here's the kicker: She's <u>very</u> <u>interested</u> in the picture business!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Wow, this lab looks great.  Except why is there a stove and refrigerator?

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: We couldn't afford any more props. If it seems weird, maybe you can add a scene where they eat dinner.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Nah, it'll work.  Where's Bela?

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: Ed, you said you were getting permission.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Uh, I couldn't reach the guy... he was in meetings all day.  But this'll be great, I promise!

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: You're sure this is gonna work?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: You're <u>sure</u>???

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: YES!  JUST DO IT!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hey.  This is looking good!  Paul, where's the octopus motor?

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: What octopus motor?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You know, to make the legs move --

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: Hey, don't blame me!  You didn't say anything about no motor when I was up on that ceiling!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Norma, this is Bela -- Bela, this is Norma.  Norma, this is Tor -- Tor, this is Norma.  Norma, this is Paul Paul, this is Norma.

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: So how long have you known Eddie?

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: Ed, I got the Lugosi lookalikes outside.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Great!  Bring 'em in!  Bunny, I gotta run.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Too tall... too short...  And this guy doesn't work at all.

turns.speaker: PAUL MARCO
turns.text: Well I was thinkin' like, when Bela played "Fu Manchu."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: That was Karloff.  Paul, you gotta try harder.  I don't want this film to be haif-assed. This time, we go for the quality.

turns.speaker: REVEREND LEMON
turns.text: ...Do you accept the Lord Jesus Christ as your savior?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What are you talking about?!  It's the premise of the movie.  It's even the title, for Christ's sake!

turns.speaker: REVEREND LEMON
turns.text: Mr. Wood!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Isn't it wonderful?  Bela lives!

turns.speaker: REVEREND LEMON
turns.text: Doesn't this strike you as a bit morbid?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, he would've loved it!  Bela's returned from the grave -- like Dracula.  CUE VAMPIRA!

turns.speaker: REVEREND LEMON
turns.text: This is our choir director.  He's gonna play the young hero.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Are you IN5ANE?  <u>I'm</u> the director! <u>I</u> make the casting decisions around here!

turns.speaker: REVEREND LEMON
turns.text: I thought this was a group effort.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: NOOOOO!!!

turns.speaker: REVEREND LEMON
turns.text: Mr. Wood?  <u>What do you think you're</u> <u>doing</u>?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm directing.

turns.speaker: REVEREND LEMON
turns.text: B-but it's our money --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: And you're gonna make a bundle.  This movie's gonna be famous!  But only if you SHUT UP, and let me do it my way!

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: Why... yes.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't you think angora has a tactile sensuality lacking in all other clothing?

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: I suppose.  It's very expensive.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's made from specially-bred rabbits that live in the Himalayas.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: What are you, an angora wholesaler?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, I work in pictures.  I'm a director-actor-writer-producer.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: Ah, c'mon!  Nobody does all that.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Two people do.  Orson Welles and me.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: Wow.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You know, you're a very attractive girl.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: My goodness, you're embarrassing me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You shouldn't be embarrassed by the truth.  Mind if I order some hotcakes...?

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: Eddie, I'm just a small-town girl. I've never done this before.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't worry, I'll teach you.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: What the heck is THIS?!!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Honey, I have a little secret to share with you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Please, be compassionate.  I'm your husband!

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: No you're not!  This marriage was never consummated.  I'm getting an annulment!

turns.speaker: ED'S VOICE
turns.text: Vampira!  Hi, this is Ed Wood.

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ED'S VOICE
turns.text: Ed Wood!  You came to my party.  I directed "Bride Of The Atom"!

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: Oh.  Yeah.  You.

turns.speaker: ED'S VOICE
turns.text: Well, I was wondering if maybe sometime you'd like to go out, and maybe grab some dinner.

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: You mean like a date?  I thought you were a fag.

turns.speaker: ED'S VOICE
turns.text: ME?!  No, uh, I'm just a transvestite.

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: Isn't that the same thing?

turns.speaker: ED'S VOICE
turns.text: No, no!  I like girls.  So how 'bout Friday?

turns.speaker: VAMPIRA
turns.text: Look, you seem like a nice guy, Ed, but you're just not my type.  But keep in touch.  Let me know when your movie opens.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No. The bathroom is off limits -and when I go to sleep they go to other programming. Unless I get up. Then they go back on the air. Unless I get up to go to the bathroom, I guess, then -

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: What if--you're vomiting?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What if I'm vomiting?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Do they show it?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I guess -- I don't -- it's all in the contract. There's this million-page contract --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'11 have to pass, Al. And it's not an age thing --

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: No! Do they show you having sex?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No. Kissing and hugging, okay, but if it's actual sex they have to cut away.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: At what point?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: At the point -- I don't -- Look you'd be on TV maybe one or two times each. I'11 try to avoid I'11 go out of my way to avoid, getting together with you. Believe me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah. I brought you some movies.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Anything good?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, I intentionally picked out a lot of crap 'cause I don't like you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Is Mom here? I gotta talk to her.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: She's in the kitchen. I'd yell for her, but I'd die.  You had a busy night last night.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah. Ma...

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: What do you love her or something?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Come on...

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Look at your face. I had a car that color.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Whatever happened to Norman Rockwell?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Norman Rockwell. He painted magazine covers. Folksy. A mailman, a boy scout, a kid visiting a doctor...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, so... ?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: They celebrated the common person.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, I don't think you can get more common than me, Al.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: No. Only celebrities now. Now, if you put a mailman on the cover of a magazine he'd better have killed someone or no one will buy it. This one to Dr. Rumpley.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Jeanette, you're hurting me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm not -- I didn't -- Al, you know how I feel about you...

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Have I ever said a bad word to you about your father?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Well, now I will. He was a crazy mean, son-of-a-bitch.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: How's your mother?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Al!

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Our neighbors gave me a ride.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Al!!

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Where is she? Is she all right?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: You thought it was me?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: It's your father. Hank. Your mother went to see him and he had a heart attack.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Went --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Are things gonna be okay with you and Mom? Is there anything I can --

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: I'm moving out.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: I'm going to be living with my brother. He's not in such good shape as I am, but... I'm looking forward to the pillow fights.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, Al ... This is just...

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Hank was always good with the ladies. Always good-looking. Hell, he's been dead for two days, he still looks better than me.

turns.speaker: TAD
turns.text: Did you see that?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TAD
turns.text: Her. That look. She likes the Ed guy better than she likes the brother.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: You're nuts.

turns.speaker: TAD
turns.text: Okay, I'm nuts.

turns.speaker: TAD
turns.text: I'11 tell you something else. The old guy in the wheelchair? The stepfather? They're gonna have him die.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: What do you mean "they're gonna have him die?"

turns.speaker: TAD
turns.text: You know, for a tearjerker. The audience falls in love with this loveable old geezer in a wheelchair and then he dies, it's ... They know what they're doing.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: This is real, Bananahead!

turns.speaker: TAD
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: So if it's a show and they have a guy die that's writing, but if it's real and they have a guy die that's murder.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: You think she really likes him?

turns.speaker: TAD
turns.text: She doesn't give a shit about him.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: You know what would be great?

turns.speaker: TAD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: If Ray would steal this girl from Ed. That would be great.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Yeah only I wish they had the sister on more.

turns.speaker: TAD
turns.text: Ooh, the sister! She is hot.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: You know it.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: What did you study?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, see, studying would've been a huge help. Where were you, then?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Ed, can I see you a second.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Okay, so you understand? We're installing a permanent camera in your bedroom, one in the kitchen, one in the living room, plus, of course, there'll always be a couple of steady-cams following you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I want you to take this.
